Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 7c8e064d33a1b9136b10f224d9ae9e9b066be012
Still haven't really tested this well enough.  Feel free to ignore the latest patchset, which only partially fixes the issues.

but in the way you propose it duplicates the "return true" line;  That's pretty subjective, and considering that there are no lines that are wrapped, saving horizonal space doesn't seem that important here for defining clear code with a single code path.
The behavior changed here, previously |sessionIsFromTransport| is set to true no matter what the |generateUserSession| returns
I think the behavior that's here is correct.  if the user session doesn't exist, it can't be from the transport.  I think in code this is more correct, and behaviorally has no difference.
I think, in else we should add some error logs

Why?  The else on this statement is still a perfectly valid path if the user has mTLS and any other auth mechanism enabled.  If the user tries to log in with, say, basic auth here, this will hit the else.  I'm not sure that needs logged, because it would happen on every connection attempt.
This diff got pulled in from the previous patchset.  Will fix.
Up to you whether to IWYI or not
Good point, yeah, I thould IWYU.  ack.

boost::asio::ip::address needs a head, right? I also see openssl headers are missing.
 
I am fine with what we have now. Adding them manually is not a smart choice. In future IWYU runs, we can fix it
I've updated the #includes that I could see;
Could you do some quick sanity testing ? Then remove the WIP

That was the plan, but I don't remember the actual steps to do it.  I'll give it a try, but we really need to get this into the standard (which is being worked) then get it supported by the "normal" tools.  This ad-hoc stuff is a mess to try to test every time we need to make a change.
